The West African Bankers' Association (WABA; French: Association des banques de l'Afrique de l'ouest ()) bụ òtù ọkachamara nke ụlọ akụ na ọrụ ego na West Africa.
O nwere isi ụlọ ọrụ ya na ọfịs ya na Benin, Burkina Faso, Cape Verde, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Sierra Leone, na Togo.
Emepụtara WABA n'August 10, 1981 na ebumnuche bụ isi nke ịkwado na imepe ụlọ mkpochapụ West African (WACH).
Nzukọ a nwere ụlọ akụ, nchekwa na ụlọ ọrụ nyocha, yana ndị otu n'otu n'otu
Onye odeakwụkwọ ukwu bụ Sega Balde, ebe Rev Ifeanyi IWANDE bụ onyeisiala.
Ụlọ akụ etiti nke mba ọ bụla sonyere na ya kwadoro njikọ ahụ
WABA na-eje ozi dị ka onye ogbugbo n'etiti ụlọ akụ na kọmitii mpaghara nke ụlọ akụ etiti.
Njikọ ahụ dị na Freetown, Sierra Leone.
